title: Introduction to R and R Studio

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a common application of R?
What is the purpose of the R Studio script editor?
choices: To write and edit R code
To display the output of R commands
To view and manage R objects
To install and update R packages
questions.answer: To write and edit R code

questions.question: What is the correct way to assign a value to a variable in R?
Which data structure in R is unidimensional and can hold elements of different types?
What is the primary difference between a matrix and a data frame in R?
choices: A matrix can only hold elements of the same type, while a data frame can hold elements of different types
A matrix is unidimensional, while a data frame is two-dimensional
A matrix is used for statistical analysis, while a data frame is used for data visualization
A matrix can hold missing values, while a data frame cannot
questions.answer: A matrix can only hold elements of the same type, while a data frame can hold elements of different types

questions.question: Which function is used to read a CSV file into R?
What does the subset() function do in R?
choices: Extracts a subset of a data object based on specified conditions
Combines two data objects based on common columns or rows
Computes summary statistics for subsets of a data object
Removes missing values from a data object
questions.answer: Extracts a subset of a data object based on specified conditions

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a basic plotting function in R?
What does the argument 'col' specify in most R plotting functions?
Which function calculates the arithmetic mean of a vector in R?
What does the sd() function compute in R?
Which function is used to perform a t-test in R?
What is the purpose of the cor.test() function in R?
choices: To test for a significant correlation between two variables
To perform a chi-square test of independence
To conduct an analysis of variance (ANOVA)
To fit a linear regression model
questions.answer: To test for a significant correlation between two variables

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of using R Markdown?
choices: To create dynamic reports that combine code, results, and explanatory text
To write and execute R code interactively
To manage and manipulate large datasets in R
To develop interactive web applications using R
questions.answer: To create dynamic reports that combine code, results, and explanatory text

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a requirement for the final project?
choices: Choosing a dataset related to Timor-Leste
Performing a comprehensive analysis using R
Writing a brief report interpreting the findings
